Problem:
Consider a system governed by a complex function \\(z(t) = Re^{i\\omega t}\\), where \\(R\\) and \\(\\omega\\) are constants, and \\(i\\) represents the imaginary unit. We examine the effect of applying a Laplace transformation defined by \\(\\mathcal{L}(f(t))(s) = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st}f(t)\\,dt\\) on this system.

If the Laplace transform is applied to \\(z(t)\\) without any intervention, and then the inverse transform is used, will the resultant function exactly match the original \\(z(t)\\)?
Explanation: The Laplace transform of a function like \\(z(t)\\), which is essentially an exponential function, can be inverted perfectly assuming all conditions for the transform and inverse transform are met. The reconstruction of the original function from its transform is exact in theoretical scenarios.
